raw_text:
Rapper 50 Cent scores chart first
 
 Rapper 50 Cent has become the first solo artist to have three singles in the US top five in the same week.
 
 His track Candy Shop remained at the top of the charts, while Disco Inferno crept up from six to five. 50 Cent also appears on rap protege The Game's song How We do, number four in the US but now outside the UK top ten. The pair had a recent dispute which saw The Game thrown out of 50 Cent's rap collective G-Unit, accusing him of disloyalty in an ongoing feud.
 
 50 Cent, who burst onto the music scene in 2003, has had less success in the UK charts, with three singles making the top ten. His debut album, Get Rich And Die Tryin', narrowly missed out on becoming a UK chart topper.
 
 But in the US, he headed the 2003 end of year charts for the album and R&B and hip hop artists. Newcomer The Game's debut reached the top of the charts five weeks ago, while 50 Cent's second collection The Masscre was released in the US at the end of last week. Last May, R&B star Usher scored a chart first, with three concurrent singles in the US Top 10, a feat which was previously matched only by The Bee Gees and The Beatles. The hit songs were taken from the 24-year-old's Confessions album, which topped the American chart for eight weeks.
llama3.2:1b: 50 Cent has had three singles in the US top five in the same week.
His tracks Candy Shop and Disco Inferno both remain at the top of the charts, while How We Do debuted at number four.
50 Cent is also appearing on The Game's song, which debuted outside the UK top ten.
llama3.2:3b: 50 Cent becomes the first solo artist to have three singles in the US top five in the same week.
His track "Candy Shop" remains at the top of the charts, while his other single "Disco Inferno" enters at number 5.
This follows a recent dispute between 50 Cent and rap protege The Game, who has been excluded from G-Unit due to disloyalty in their ongoing feud.
gemma2:2b: 50 Cent achieved a first by having three singles in the US top five simultaneously.
"Candy Shop" remained at #1, "Disco Inferno" moved up to #5, and he features on The Game's song "How We Do", which is #4.
50 Cent had more UK chart success than The Game.
Usher's achievement of three singles in the top ten simultaneously, previously unmatched by artists like The Bee Gees and The Beatles, was last seen five weeks ago.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Rapper 50 Cent has become the first solo artist to have three singles in the top five of the US charts in the same week.
His tracks "Candy Shop" and "Disco Inferno" made it into the top 10, while his song "How We Do" became a number four on the UK chart.
Despite this success, 50 Cent's debut album, "Get Rich And Die Tryin'", narrowly missed out on becoming a UK chart-topper due to the feud with The Game.
His second studio album, "The Masscre", was released last week and reached the top of the US charts at the end of May.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Rapper 50 Cent becomes first solo artist to have three singles in top five in same week; Candy Shop remains at #1, Disco Inferno moves up from six to fifth place; The Game and 50 Cent had a recent feud that resulted in him being thrown out of G-Unit.
qwen2.5:3b: Rapper 50 Cent is the first solo artist to have three singles in the US top five simultaneously.
Candy Shop remained at number one while Disco Inferno climbed from sixth to fifth place.
He appears on The Game’s How We Do, which peaked at four in the US but outside UK top ten following a dispute.
In contrast, 50 Cent has had less success in the UK with only three singles reaching the top ten.
His debut album narrowly missed becoming a UK chart topper.
Usher previously achieved a similar feat in 2004 with three concurrent singles in the US Top 10 from his Confessions album.
opencoder:1.5b: Rapper 50 Cent scores chart first with three singles in the US top five while his debut album, Get Rich And Die Tryin', narrowly missed out on becoming a UK chart topper.
But in the US, he ended up at the top of the charts four weeks after the album was released.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Rapper 50 Cent is the first solo artist in the US to have three singles rank within the top five in a single week.
His track "Candy Shop" was number one, while "Disco Inferno" moved up from six to five.
The song "How We Do" also made the chart.
Despite this success, 50 Cent's UK chart performance was less impressive with only three singles reaching the top ten.
The Game had a debut hit and was on The Game's second album, which topped eight weeks.
Usher, R&B star, achieved a first week record with three hits from his album that reached eight weeks at number one.
tinyllama:1.1b: Rapper 50 Cent becomes first solo artist to score three US charts in one week with Candy Shopp and Disco Inferno, dropping from six to five in the UK chart.
He has had less success in the UK singles market, having only managed three entries.
However, he scored an end-of-year chart debut for his 2003 album Get Rich & Die Tryin', with three tracks making it to number four.
In the US, The Game's debut album, The Masscre, also scored a chart first, thanks to three consecutive top ten singles in late 2004.
50 Cent's second album, The G-Unit's second collection The Masscre, had three concurrent hits in the US Top 10, but failed to achieve the same level of success.
tinydolphin:1.1b: 50 Cent has scored his first US top five with "Candy Shop," debuting at number one, while "Disco Inferno" climbed from six to fifth place.
The track featuring rapper The Game is now outside the UK top ten.
However, 50 Cent and The Game have had a long-standing feud that saw The Game kicked out of G-Unit, accusing him of disloyalty.
Despite their differences, "Candy Shop" has been a chart success for both artists in the US.

He also appears on rap protege The Game's song, How We do.
50 Cent was controversially thrown out of G-Unit by The Game, accusing him of disloyalty in a feud.
However, he still managed to score a top five hit with his latest album, The Masscre.
R&B singer Usher previously achieved the same feat with three concurrent singles in the US Top 10.

50 Cent, The Game (outside UK top ten with "How We Do").

stablelm-zephyr:3b: Rapper 50 Cent achieved three singles in the US top five in the same week, becoming the first solo artist to accomplish this feat.
His tracks "Candy Shop," "Disco Inferno," and a collaboration with The Game titled "How We Do" entered the charts simultaneously.
Despite less success in UK charts compared to his earlier work, 50 Cent has had chart-topping achievements in the US since his debut in 2003.
This accomplishment echoes a previous milestone set by R&B star Usher, who also had three concurrent singles in the US top 10 from his album Confessions, which topped American charts for eight weeks.

His song "Candy Shop" remained at number one, "Disco Inferno" moved up to number five, and he featured on The Game's "How We Do" at number four.

stablelm2:1.6b: Rapper Chris "Cent" Brown becomes the first solo artist to have three singles in the US top five at the same time with his track Candy Shop, while The Game's song How We do is number four.
Cent appears on another rapper's song and has had less success in the UK charts but achieved chart success in the US.

granite3.1-dense:2b: 50 Cent, a renowned US rapper, achieved a unique milestone by becoming the first solo artist with three singles in the US top five within the same week.
His single "Candy Shop" held the top spot, while "Disco Inferno" rose to fifth place.
50 Cent also features on The Game's song "How We do," currently at number four in the US but dropped from the UK top ten following a recent dispute.
Despite his success in the US, 50 Cent has had limited UK chart impact with three top-ten singles and a nearly top-charting debut album, "Get Rich And Die Tryin'."
The Game's debut, released five weeks ago, reached the top of the charts, while 50 Cent's latest compilation, "The Masscre," was recently unveiled in the US.
This feat surpasses previous achievements by artists like Usher and The Bee Gees/The Beatles, who each held three songs in the US Top 10 concurrently during their respective album peaks.
